item.title: Architecture Overview
item.description:
Architecture Overview#

Core architecture principles and rules of PA-Layer.

Hexagonal Architecture (Port/Adapter)#

Core Idea#

Separate business logic from technical details.

             ┌─────────────────────────────┐
             │                             │
   REST ────►│ Port                        │
             │  ↓                          │
   gRPC ────►│ Domain Logic (Business Core)│◄──── DB
             │  ↓                          │
GraphQL ────►│ Port                        │◄──── Cache
             │                             │
             └─────────────────────────────┘
             
              Left: Driving Adapters (input)
              Right: Driven Adapters (output)

Application in PA-Layer#

We adopt only the core concepts of Hexagonal, not full implementation:

Original Hexagonal PA-Layer Application
Port (Interface) Port Document - Interface spec
Adapter (Implementation) Code Implementation - Kotlin/TS/Go
Driving/Driven distinction Simplified to input/output direction

CQS (Command-Query Separation)#

Principle#

Command Query
Changes state Reads state
Has side effects No side effects
Usually no return or Result Returns data

PA-Layer Application#

 1
 2
 3
 4
 5
 6
 7

10
11
12
13

// ❌ Anti-pattern: Mixed Command and Query
interface UserPort {
    fun createUser(request: CreateUserRequest): User  // Creates and returns
}

// ✅ Recommended: Separated
interface UserCommandPort {
    suspend fun createUser(command: CreateUserCommand): CreateUserResult
}

interface UserQueryPort {
    suspend fun findUser(query: FindUserQuery): User?
    suspend fun listUsers(query: ListUsersQuery): List<User>
}

Layer Rules#

Dependency Direction#

Upper Layer → Lower Layer (unidirectional)

  API
   ↓
  L2
   ↓
  LM (optional)
   ↓
  L1

@Component
class LoginAdapter(
    private val userPort: UserPort,
    private val tokenPort: TokenPort
) : LoginPort {
    
    @Transactional
    override suspend fun login(request: LoginRequest): LoginResult {
        val user = userPort.findByEmail(request.email)
            ?: return LoginResult.InvalidCredentials
        
        if (!user.verifyPassword(request.password)) {
            return LoginResult.InvalidCredentials
        }
        
        val tokens = tokenPort.generate(user.id)
        return LoginResult.Success(tokens.accessToken, tokens.refreshToken)
    }
}

import { http } from '@/lib/http';
import { AuthPort } from './AuthPort';
import { LoginRequest, LoginResult } from './types';

export class AuthAdapter implements AuthPort {
  async login(request: LoginRequest): Promise<LoginResult> {
    try {
      const response = await http.post('api/auth/login', {
        json: request
      }).json<LoginResponse>();
      
      localStorage.setItem('accessToken', response.accessToken);
      localStorage.setItem('refreshToken', response.refreshToken);
      
      return { type: 'success', data: response };
    } catch (error: any) {
      if (error.response?.status === 401) {
        return { type: 'invalidCredentials' };
      }
      return { type: 'networkError', message: error.message };
    }
  }
  
  async logout(): Promise<void> {
    localStorage.removeItem('accessToken');
    localStorage.removeItem('refreshToken');
  }
  
  isAuthenticated(): boolean {
    return !!localStorage.getItem('accessToken');
  }
}

export const authAdapter = new AuthAdapter();

import { create } from 'zustand';
import { authAdapter } from '@/ports/auth/AuthAdapter';
import { LoginRequest, UserInfo, LoginResult } from '@/ports/auth/types';

interface AuthState {
  user: UserInfo | null;
  isLoading: boolean;
  error: string | null;
  isAuthenticated: boolean;
  
  login: (request: LoginRequest) => Promise<LoginResult>;
  logout: () => Promise<void>;
  clearError: () => void;
}

export const useAuthStore = create<AuthState>((set) => ({
  user: null,
  isLoading: false,
  error: null,
  isAuthenticated: authAdapter.isAuthenticated(),
  
  login: async (request: LoginRequest) => {
    set({ isLoading: true, error: null });
    
    const result = await authAdapter.login(request);
    
    switch (result.type) {
      case 'success':
        set({
          user: result.data.user,
          isAuthenticated: true,
          isLoading: false
        });
        break;
      case 'invalidCredentials':
        set({ error: 'Invalid email or password.', isLoading: false });
        break;
      case 'networkError':
        set({ error: `Network error: ${result.message}`, isLoading: false });
        break;
    }
    
    return result;
  },
  
  logout: async () => {
    await authAdapter.logout();
    set({ user: null, isAuthenticated: false, error: null });
  },
  
  clearError: () => set({ error: null })
}));

import { useState, FormEvent } from 'react';
import { useAuth } from '@/hooks/useAuth';
import { useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom';

export function LoginForm() {
  const { login, isLoading, error, clearError } = useAuth();
  const navigate = useNavigate();
  
  const [email, setEmail] = useState('');
  const [password, setPassword] = useState('');
  
  const handleSubmit = async (e: FormEvent) => {
    e.preventDefault();
    clearError();
    
    const result = await login({ email, password });
    
    if (result.type === 'success') {
      navigate('/dashboard');
    }
  };
  
  return (
    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit} className="space-y-4">
      {error && (
        <div className="p-3 bg-red-100 text-red-700 rounded">
          {error}
        </div>
      )}
      
      <div>
        <label htmlFor="email">Email</label>
        <input
          type="email"
          id="email"
          value={email}
          onChange={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
          required
          disabled={isLoading}
        />
      </div>
      
      <div>
        <label htmlFor="password">Password</label>
        <input
          type="password"
          id="password"
          value={password}
          onChange={(e) => setPassword(e.target.value)}
          required
          disabled={isLoading}
        />
      </div>
      
      <button type="submit" disabled={isLoading}>
        {isLoading ? 'Signing in...' : 'Sign In'}
      </button>
    </form>
  );
}

│     Adapter     │  ← HTTP Implementation
└────────┬────────┘
         │
┌────────▼────────┐
│      Port       │  ← Interface Definition
└─────────────────┘

Benefits#

Aspect Description
Testability Replace Port with Mock for unit testing
Consistency Same interface as Backend Port
Maintainability HTTP implementation encapsulated in Adapter
State Management Simple global state with Zustand
